column4: Hey, I have sshd running on my desktop with the wireless router, and when I type "ssh braxton@desktop" on my laptop connected to the wireless router, is says connection refused!
Try using the IP address instead of host name.  Also, do you have UFW enabled?
UFW? Sorry, I'm a newb to ssh, just trying it out.
If you don't know what ufw is you don't need to worry about it then :)
alright.
so just go to whatismyip.com?
I'll just do that, yeah.
First up, are you trying to connect remotely or from the same LAN as the target box
If you're connecting remotely and are behind a router/firewall you'll most likely need to set it up to forward port 22 to the right box
But I don't think I can do that with a dynamic IP T>T
My ISP doesn't support static IP's, there all douchebags. >,<
You can use a service like dyndns.org to provide access to a dynamic IP.  There are also instructions on their site for installing a daemon on your computer that will update the dyndns.org entry
*they're
I use the service myself
:O
can I use this for other things too, like a webserver!?
Well, you COULD but a residential connection wouldn't likely have much bandwidth for hosting, and your ISP might complain
I love you.
Mind if I query?
Hm?
If you use dyndns for something like SSH, you'll probably want to change the port to something high instead of the default of 22, in case some script-kiddy out there tries to brute force it
Lawl, script-kiddy.
Alright.
